DOC.criteria: Cataractous Eyes comorbidity Patient old 50 year old Regular corneal astigmatism < 0.75 dioptre automatic keratometer ( regularity determine topography keratometry ) < 1.0 dioptre steep axis cylinder 90° 120° Spontaneously emit desire spectacle independence surgery realistic expectation . Availability , willingness sufficient cognitive awareness comply examination procedure Signed informed consent Unrealistic expectation Irregular astigmatism Difficulty cooperation ( distance home , general health condition ) Acute chronic disease illness would increase risk confound study result ( e.g . diabetes mellitus ( retinopathy ) , immunocompromised , glaucoma etc… ) Any ocular comorbidity History ocular trauma prior ocular surgery include refractive procedure Capsule zonular abnormality may affect postoperative centration tilt lens ( e.g . pseudoexfoliation syndrome , chronic Uveitis , Marfan 's syndrome ) Pupil abnormality ( nonreactive , tonic pupil , abnormally shape pupil pupil dilate mesopic/scotopic condition )
